intro: Pinguicula pallida, commonly known as the pale butterwort, is a carnivorous plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its glandular, sticky leaves that trap and digest small insects. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its flowers are small, bell-shaped, and usually pink or purple in color. Pinguicula pallida is a perennial herb that reproduces through seeds and can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
